Package com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Connection
  • public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implies a connection to a Client however it can not be instantised.
    A connection is created when a Client joins the Server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getId()
      Returns the id of the connection
      If the method setId(int) was never called -1 will be returned
      java.net.InetAddress getInetAddress()  
      int getPort()  
      void send​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Sends the specified Object to the peer which the socket is connected to
      void setId​(int id)
      Sets the id of the connection so as to distinguish from other connections
      If this method was never called the id will be -1
      void stop()  

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • setId

        public void setId​(int id)
        Sets the id of the connection so as to distinguish from other connections
        If this method was never called the id will be -1
        Parameters:

        Returns the id of the connection
        If the method setId(int) was never called -1 will be returned
